metadata.title: CVE-2019-10081 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: HTTP/2 (2.4.20 through 2.4.39) very early pushes, for example configuredwith "H2PushResource", could lead to an overwrite of memory in the pushingrequest's pool, leading to crashes. The memory copied is that of theconfigured push link header values, not data supplied by the client.

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
